pages.title: Pages
pages.tagline: Deploy front-end applications in record time.
pages.overview.tutorials.title: View How Tos
pages.overview.tutorials.body: Deploy sites developed with React, Vue, Gatsby, and more.
pages.overview.invite_members.body: Invite team members to join and collaborate on projects.
pages.overview.plan_tooltip: Your plan includes <0></0> concurrent build and <1></1> total builds per month.
pages.overview.no_search_matches: No projects matched your search. Try searching for a different name.
pages.overview.deleted_project_toast: Your project <0>%{projectName}</0> was successfully deleted. It may take a few minutes for content on the following domains to stop being served:
pages.overview.wrangler_cli_guide.body: Create a project using the Wrangler Command Line Interface (CLI).
pages.no_deployments: This project has not been deployed
pages.project_details.deployments_paused: Repository deployments are currently paused. <0>Resume deployments</0> to reenable.
pages.overview.empty_state.body: Set up and deploy a project from your personal or team Git account.
pages.project_details.deploy_cta: Deploy project to publish your site live. Cloudflare will then automatically build and deploy future repository commits.
pages.project_details.deploy_cta.asset_u: Upload your site assets to create a new deployment.
You can also upload files through Wrangler CLI
pages.modals.delete_project.title: Delete project?
pages.modals.delete_project.body: Deleting <0>%{name}</0> is permanent and cannot be undone. Deleting the project also deletes:
pages.project_details.settings.delete_pr: Permissions for this repository are managed in your <0>Cloudflare Pages application</0> on GitHub.
Permissions for this repository are managed in your <0>Cloudflare Pages application</0> on GitLab.
pages.modals.delete_project.list:
* deployments,
* environment variables,
* deployed static assets
* git integrations,
* Access policies, and
* Web Analytics integrations
pages.modals.delete_project.consequences: The project hostname <0>%{domain}</0> will become available. Deleting the project does not affect your %{provider} repository <1>%{repo_name}</1>.
The project hostname <0>%{domain}</0> will become available.
pages.modals.delete_project.toast: This action is permanent and cannot be undone.
pages.modals.pause_deployments.title: Pause deployments?
pages.modals.pause_deployments.body: Pausing deployments for <0>%{name}</0> means Cloudflare will not build or deploy your project automatically when you push new commits.<1>You can resume deployments at any time.</1>
pages.modals.resume_deployments.title: Resume deployments?
pages.modals.resume_deployments.body: Cloudflare will build & deploy <0>%{name}</0> automatically when you push new commits to <1>%{source}</1>.
pages.modals.delete_domain.title: Remove domain?
pages.modals.delete_domain.body: Visitors will no longer be able to visit your site using <0>https://%{fqdn}</0>.
pages.modals.delete_domain.body.1: The CNAME record pointing to your project will be removed to make this change. You will be able to set it up again in the future.
pages.modals.cancel_deployment.title: Cancel build?
pages.modals.cancel_to_change_settings.b: To change build and deployment settings, you must cancel the current build.
pages.modals.cancel_deployment.body: Your build will be canceled and your site will not be deployed. You can <0>Retry deployment</0> to restart the deployment process.
pages.modals.proceed_without_deploying.b:
Your deployment will continue but if it fails, your site will not be available for visitors.

To initiate another deployment, **Retry deployment** or push a commit to your Production branch **%{productionBranch}**.
pages.modals.delete_deployment.title: Delete deployment?
pages.modals.delete_deployment.body1: Are you sure you want to delete the deployment at <0>%{staticUrl}</0>?
pages.modals.delete_deployment.body2: Build logs for this deployment will also be deleted. This action is permanent and cannot be undone.
pages.modals.delete_deployment.skip_body: Are you sure you want to delete the deployment for <0></0>?
This action is permanent and cannot be undone.
pages.modals.retry_confirm.title: Retry deployment?
pages.modals.retry_confirm.body1: Retrying this deployment will reinitiate the build.
pages.modals.retry_confirm.body2: Future commits to this branch will not automatically deploy. To enable deployments of this branch configure <0>Branch deployments</0>.
pages.modals.rollback_deployment_confirm: There is currently a queued build that will update Production once it succeeds. When rolling back to a deployment keep in mind that the queued build may update Production.
pages.modals.rollback_deployment.title: Rollback to this deployment?
pages.modals.rollback_deployment.body1: Rolling back to this deployment will immediately take the place of the current Production deployment.
pages.modals.rollback_deployment.body2: This action will impact your site available at:
pages.modals.rollback_deployment.body3: With automatic deployments enabled, your next commit will update your Production environment.
pages.modals.rollback_deployment.body4: With automatic deployments paused, your next commit <0>will not</0> update your Production environment.
pages.modals.rollback_deployment.deploym: Production was rolled back to the deployment at <0>%{staticUrl}</0>.
pages.modals.disable_web_analytics.title: Disable Web Analytics?
pages.modals.disable_web_analytics.body: Cloudflare will stop providing insights into your project's visits, page views, requests, status codes, and other analytics provided by Cloudflare Web Analytics.
pages.modals.disable_fast_builds.title: Disable Fast builds?
pages.modals.disable_fast_builds.body:
By disabling Fast builds, your project will now use the old infrastructure. This may result in slower build times.

You can re-enable Fast builds at any time.
pages.delete_deployment.disabled_tooltip: This deployment cannot be deleted because it is currently your active <0>Production</0> deployment.
This deployment is assigned to an alias and cannot be deleted until a more recent deployment takes its place.
pages.delete_deployment.deployment_delet: The deployment at <0>%{staticUrl}</0> has been deleted.
pages.asset_uploader.dropping: Drop files to upload assets to your project
pages.project_details.settings.name: General
pages.project_details.onboarding.project: Select a method to create your project
Deploy your site in 3 easy steps by connecting to GitHub or GitLab.
Create a name for your project:
Your project is ready. Add a folder or zip file to get started.
Maximum upload size is 25 MiB per file
Upload your siteu2019s assets including HTML, CSS, and JS files directly from your computer.
Download a demo project to test it out!
Your upload exceeds the limit of %{numberOfFiles} files. Please try uploading a smaller amount.
Cloudflare Pages only supports uploading a single folder or a single zip file. The contents of your zip file or folder will be used to deploy your project.
This upload is still in progress.

Are you sure you want to permanately remove all %{numberOfFiles} of your files?

You can choose to upload your files again.
Deploy your files using the Wrangler command line interface (CLI).
pages.project_details.onboarding.asset_u: Deploy a site by uploading your project
Name your project and upload your siteu2019s assets including HTML, CSS, and JS files that you would like to deploy.
Need a project to upload? Download a demo
pages.project_details.custom_domains.sub: Set up custom domains to point to your site.
pages.project_details.custom_domains.no_: Add a custom domain for your site
Your projectu2019s hostname is <0>%{subdomain}</0>. Make it easier for your visitors to find your site by setting up a custom domain.
pages.project_details.custom_domains.dom: Before adding <0>%{domain}</0> to your Pages project, you'll need to transfer your DNS to Cloudflare.
Once your nameservers are correctly configured, your custom domain will automatically be enabled.
pages.project_details.custom_domains.onb: Enter in a registered domain or subdomain you own.
<0>%{domain}</0> is being set up. It may take up to 48 hours for DNS records to update and for your site to become viewable by visitors.
Domain does not exist. Only registered domains may be set up.
That domain is already associated with an existing project.
Before adding <0>%{domain}</0> to your Pages project, you'll need to transfer your DNS to Cloudflare.
Enterprise-grade authoritative DNS service that offers the fastest response time, unparalleled redundancy, and advanced security with built-in DDoS mitigation and DNSSEC. <0>Learn more</0>
Once the DNS transfer is complete, you'll be able to add this Custom Domain to your Pages project.
Transfer your DNS to Cloudflare. Once the transfer is complete, you'll be able to add this Custom Domain to your Pages project.
To set up <0>%{domain}</0>, youu2019ll need to configure DNS records.
Use your current DNS provider. Set up a CNAME record to point your domain to Cloudflare.
Cloudflare will add these DNS records to activate <0>%{domain}</0> for your projectu2019s site:
Cloudflare will update this DNS record to activate <0>%{domain}</0> for your projectu2019s site:
You currently have a wildcard record for *.%{rootDomain}. While the record will remain, requests to %{subdomain}.%{rootDomain} will now be served from your Cloudflare Pages site.
Once updated, visitors will be able to access your site by visiting <0>%{domain}</0>.
Add a CNAME record at your DNS provider to point <0>%{domain}</0> to your projectu2019s site on Cloudflare.
Once youu2019ve added your records, <0>Check DNS records</0> to initiate a verification check.
Your records for <0>%{domain}</0> are being rechecked. Youu2019ll be notified by email when your domain is activated.
<0>%{domain}</0> will become automatically enabled if your records are correctly configured. DNS changes at your provider may take up to 24 hours to be updated globally.
pages.project_details.custom_domains.dom: Domain activated. Your DNS setup is complete.
pages.project_details.settings.edit.erro: Project name must be less than 64 characters.
pages.project_details.settings.edit.desc: Changes will take effect on the next deployment.
pages.project_details.settings.project_d: Renaming your project will not impact any hostnames or deployments.
pages.project_details.settings.members.d: Invite members to the <0>%{accountName}</0> Cloudflare account via email to collaborate on all projects.
pages.project_details.settings.access_po: Access policy could not be created. <0>Enable access policy</0> to try again.
Access policy created. Your preview deployments are now restricted to members of %{accountName}.
Control access to your project's Preview deployments with <0>Cloudflare Access</0>.
Only allow members on <0>%{accountName}</0> to view preview deployments using a one-time PIN.
Emails of members of <0>%{accountName}</0> Cloudflare account.
This projectu2019s Preview deployments are viewable by anyone with the deployment links. Enable access policies to control access to your Preview deployments.
Custom access policies can be configured in the <0>Access dashboard</0>.
pages.project_details.settings.web_analy: Gain visibility into your projectu2019s site traffic with <0>Cloudflare Web Analytics</0>. See visits, page views, requests, status codes, and more across all your projectu2019s domains.
Web Analytics has now been enabled. Changes will take effect on the next deployment.
Web Analytics has been disabled. Changes will take effect on the next deployment.
pages.project_details.settings.delete_pr: Deleting this project will permanently delete all deployments, environment variables, domain configurations, deployed static assets, git integrations, Access policies, and Web Analytics integrations associated with this project. Your %{provider} repository will not be deleted.
Deleting this project will permanently delete all deployments, domain configurations, deployed static assets, Access policies, and Web Analytics integrations associated with this project.
pages.project_details.settings.branch_de: Specify how branches are deployed to environments. <0>Deploying branches</0>
Specify which branches are automatically deployed to each environment. <0>Deploying branches</0>
Your %{productionBranch} branch now has automatic deployments enabled.
Your %{productionBranch} branch now has automatic deployments disabled.
All non-production branches now have automatic deployments enabled.
All non-production branches now have automatic deployments disabled.
Automatic deployments are now enabled for specific branches.
Specify custom branches for automatic deployments.
Using wildcard syntax, specify which branches will be included for automatic deployment.
Using wildcard syntax, specify which branches will be excluded from automatic deployment.
Commits to your Production branch will automatically trigger deployments to your Production environment.
Everything but branches starting with preview/:
pages.project_details.settings.build_con: Specify build settings specific to your repository. <0>Configuring builds</0>
Select a framework to prefill recommended settings.
Used to trigger your projectu2019s build.
Directory where your build output will be published.
Your projectu2019s root directory where Cloudflare will run the build command.
pages.project_details.settings.deploy_ho: Automatically trigger branch deployments from a headless CMS or another service using unique URLs. <0>Using deploy hooks</0>
<0>%{hookName}</0> was added. To use this deploy hook, sent a Post request to this webhook to trigger a deployment in the <1>%{branch}</1> branch.
Add a deploy hook by creating a name and selecting a desired branch.
To use this deploy hook, add this URL to your service:
Are you sure you want to delete the Build hook: <0>%{name}</0>? Any new commits using this deploy hook will not be deployed automatically.
Test by sending a POST request:
pages.project_details.settings.source.ed: Automatically add build comments on open pull requests
pages.project_details.settings.git_integ: Cloudflare automatically builds and deploys using this repositoryu2019s source code.
pages.project_details.settings.github_in: Cloudflare automatically deploys using this connected GitHub repositoryu2019s source code. <0>Integrating GitHub</0>
pages.project_details.settings.gitlab_in: Cloudflare automatically deploys using this connected GitLab repositoryu2019s source code. <0>Integrating GitLab</0>
pages.project_details.settings.git_integ: Builds and deployments are triggered by new commits.
There is no repository currently connected to this project. Set up a repository to enable automatic builds and deployments.
pages.project_details.settings.fast_buil:
Cloudflare Pages is moving to a new, much faster build infrastructure. While this is in Beta, you can opt-in or out on a per-project basis here.

You can enable or disable Fast builds until the old infrastructure is deprecated. On May 5th, all projects will use the new infrastructure.

We expect all users to see a significant speed up to the 'Initializing build environment' stage of all Pages builds, and similar-or-better performance in the other stages. If you're experiencing problems, let us know in the #fast-builds-beta channel on Discord.
Fast builds is now enabled for your future builds.
Fast builds is now disabled for your future builds.
pages.project_details.settings.environme: Define variables for your Production environment.
Define variables for your Preview environment.
There are no variables defined for this environment.
A variable with that name already exists
pages.build_queued_description: Waiting for other builds to complete
pages.connect_git_account_info: To deploy a site, first select it from your personal or team Git account.
pages.connect_github_account_info: To deploy a site, first select it from your personal or team GitHub account.
pages.connect_gitlab_account_info: To deploy a site, first select it from your personal or team GitLab account.
pages.connect_github_account_success: You can now deploy sites from <0>%{accountName}</0>
pages.deploy_site_info: Learn how to deploy your site
pages.choose_repository.title: Select repository
pages.choose_repository.message: Select your site developed using any of the <0>supported frameworks</0> or no framework at all.
pages.build_setup.title: Set up builds and deployments
pages.build_setup.message: Specify how Cloudflare automatically builds and deploys your repository's commits.
pages.build_setup.description: Configure automatic builds and deployments for <0></0>
pages.first_deployment.title: Deploy site
pages.first_deployment.message: Your site will be deployed to a free SSL-enabled hostname. Configure custom domains, restrict access, invite collaborators, and more.
pages.first_deployment.succeeded_message: Your site was built and deployed to:
pages.first_deployment.failed_message: The deployment failed due to an error.
pages.first_deployment.canceled_message: The build and deployment has been canceled.
pages.first_deployment.restart_cta: <0>Check your build settings</0> or <1>retry deployment</1> to restart the build process.
pages.first_deployment.success_card.body: You can now do more with your site. Invite collaborators, protect previews, enable Web Analytics and more.
pages.project_name_info: This name will be used to generate a permanent hostname on pages.dev.
pages.project_hostname_info: Your project will be deployed to <0>%{hostname}</0>.
pages.production_branch_info: Pushes to this branch automatically trigger deployments to the Production environment. Pushes to all other branches will trigger deployments within the Preview environment.
pages.production_deployment_info: Used to update the Production version of your site visible to visitors on my-site.pages.dev as well as any configured custom domains.
pages.preview_deployment_info: Used to preview versions of your site without deploying to Production.
pages.build_settings_info: If your project uses a static site generator or build tool, set the build instructions for Cloudflare.
pages.build_settings.change_build_settin: To change build settings for your next deployment go to this project's <0>Settings</0>.
pages.build_command_tooltip: Cloudflare will run this command to initiate builds for your project. Dependencies for Ruby, Node.js, Python, PHP, Go and more are supported by the <0>build environment</0>.
pages.disable_pr_comments_tooltip: If enabled, Cloudflare Pages will add build comments with build statuses and preview links on open pull requests.
pages.build_directory_tooltip: Directory that contains your built assets and HTML files.
pages.root_directory_info: Your projectu2019s root directory, where Cloudflare runs the <0>build command</0>. If your site is not in a subdirectory, leave this path value empty.
pages.import_repo.heading: Deploy a site from your account
pages.import_repo.subheading: Select a repository to connect as your projectu2019s source code. New commits will trigger Cloudflare to automatically build and deploy your changes.
pages.import_git_repo.heading: Create your project
pages.import_github_repo.heading: Create a project from your GitHub repository
pages.import_github_repo.subheading: Select a repository to connect as your projectu2019s source code. New commits will trigger Cloudflare to automatically build and deploy your changes.
pages.select_a_repository_github_info: If your repository is not shown, configure repository access for the <0>Cloudflare Pages</0> app on GitHub.
pages.create_project.environment_variabl: Add variables to be used during build time for Production and Preview environments. Variables for each environment can be changed separately later.
pages.in_use_tooltip: <0>%{repoName}</0> is already connected to an existing project. To use this repository for a new project, first disconnect it from your other projectu2019s Settings page.
pages.no_repositories: There are no repositories on this %{provider} account to connect to.
pages.errors.unknown_error: An unknown error occurred. Please try again later.
pages.errors.duplicate_project_name: A project with this name already exists on this account
pages.errors.project_name_dashes: Project name cannot begin or end with -
pages.errors.project_name_invalid_charac: Project name can only contain lowercase letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), dashes
pages.errors.too_many_projects: You have reached the soft limit for the number of projects on your account. Please <0>contact support</0> to create more projects.
pages.deployment_status.queued: Waiting for other builds to finish
pages.deployment_status.skipped_explaine: The deployment was skipped based on your <0>commit message</0> or <1>build configuration</1>.
pages.deployment_status.active: This deployment is currently in progress
pages.build_logs.deploy_error: The deployment failed due to an internal error. **Retry deployment** to restart the build process.
pages.build_logs.cancelled: This build and deployment has been cancelled. **Retry deployment** to restart the build process.
pages.build_logs.truncated_divider:
----- TRUNCATED - click "Download log" to view more logs
----- Tailing last 100 lines:
pages.build_logs.truncated_note: Note: Not all logs could be displayed, click "Download log" to view more
pages.functions.description: Functions enable you to integrate with Workers directly within your Pages projects to create and seamlessly deploy full-stack applications. To get started, include a <0>/functions</0> directory in your project.
pages.functions.configuration_descriptio: Configuration of routing for this deployment.
pages.functions.bindings_description: To change bindings for your next deployment go to this projectu2019s <0>Settings</0>.
pages.functions.bindings_empty_state: Bindings enable your website to utilize data storage solutions from the Workers platform. To add bindings for your next deployment go to this projectu2019s <0>Settings</0>.
pages.redirects.description: Customize where your visitors get routed when a request is made. Easily define temporary or permanent redirect rules using a <0>_redirects</0> file. Any changes to this file will be applied to the next deployment.
pages.headers.description: Define outgoing HTTP response headers for static or dynamic URLs within a <0>_headers</0> file. Any changes to this file will be applied to the next deployment.
pages.headers.configuration_description: Configuration of headers for this deployment.
pages.bindings.update_bindings_notice: Binding updates will be available for your next deployment.
pages.bindings.workers_kv.description: Workers KV is a global, low-latency, key-value storage. Workers KV is great for data your website needs to read quickly and frequently, but write relatively infrequently. Get started by creating a KV Namespace from the Workers dashboard.
pages.bindings.kv_namespace_bindings.des: Utilize key-value storage for your website at hundreds of Cloudflare data centers.
pages.bindings.durable_object_bindings.d: Manage state with low-latency coordination and consistent real-time storage for your website.
pages.bindings.durable_object_bindings.e: There are no Durable Objects created. Check out the <0>Durable Objects documentation</0> to get started.
pages.bindings.durable_object_bindings.n: Durable Objects is available on the Workers Paid Plan. Using Durable Objects requires <0>Wrangler CLI</0>.
pages.bindings.missing_namespace: This namespace no longer exists and can not be read from or written to.
pages.functions_requests_limit_exceeded_: Requests to your websites may be returning errors as youu2019ve reached your functions requests limit for today. Your functions will respond to requests again when your usage resets at 12:00AM (UTC). Learn more about <0>functions requests limits</0>.
pages.functions_blog_announcement: You can now include functions directly within your Pages project with the help of Workers to create and seamlessly deploy full-stack applications. <0>Read the blog</0>
pages.fast_builds_announcement: New! Try out the faster build infrastructure. Enable the Fast builds Beta from your projectu2019s Builds & Deployments settings.
pages.fast_builds_warning: On May 5th, 2022 all of your projects will only use the new build infrastructure. We recommend that you test your builds as soon as possible by enabling the Fast Build Beta on these projects:
pages.fast_builds_force_migrated_warning: All of your projects are now on the new build infrastructure. If you encounter any issues, please reach out on Discord.
pages.wrangler.title: Create project with Wrangler CLI
pages.wrangler.description: Use this guide to create and deploy your site from the Wrangler command line interface (CLI).
pages.wrangler.step2: Authenticate Wrangler with your Cloudflare account
pages.wrangler.step2.1: To enable Wrangler to deploy your scripts to Cloudflare, you'll need to authenticate by logging in to your Cloudflare account.
pages.wrangler.step2.2: When wrangler automatically opens your browser to display Cloudflare's consent screen, click the <0>Allow</0> button. This will send an API Token to Wrangler.
pages.wrangler.step3.1: If you are using a framework (e.g. React, Gatsby, Astro, etc.) you can run a build command to generate a folder of static assets.
pages.wrangler.step4.1: Publish a folder of static assets as a new deployment. This will automatically pull in git information if available.
pages.wrangler.step5.1: You've installed Wrangler and deployed your site using Pages. You can find the URL to your deployed site in your terminal.
